prompt:
Describe the process of growing tomatoes in a garden setting.
Growing tomatoes in a garden setting requires careful planning and execution. First, select a sunny location with well-drained soil. Prepare the bed by incorporating organic matter such as compost or manure. Plant tomato seeds or seedlings 1 to 2 feet apart and about 4 inches deep. Keep the plants evenly moistened, especially during fruiting stages. Prune off suckers to improve air circulation and fruit production. Tomatoes require staking or caging for support as they mature.
